# draggedImageLocation

**Instance Property**

The current location of the dragged image’s origin, in the base coordinate system of the destination object’s window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var draggedImageLocation: NSPoint { get }
```

## Discussion

The image moves along with the mouse pointer (the position of which is given by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingInfo/draggingLocation]) but may be positioned at some offset.

## Getting image information

- **draggedImage**: The image that represents the dragging item.
